title: SSN is exposed on slides, previous critical report was not fixed in an appropriate way
content:
Summary:
SSN is exposed on slides, previous critical report was not fixed in an appropriate way
Description:
SSN is exposed on a screenshot. Slide 13th. SSN is covered by an olive/green rectangle which is moveable. The image itself was not updated.
██████wp-content/uploads/2018/12/████████
The issue was previously submitted and was not fixed in an appropriate way.
https://hackerone.com/reports/█████████
The file is easy to find by the file name.
https://duckduckgo.com/?q=%22███%22&t=hj&ia=web
Impact
Critical
███████ is a real person (officer) according to ██████████
Step-by-step Reproduction Instructions
Download the file ████████wp-content/uploads/2018/12/█████
Navigate to slide 13
Move the olive rectangle which covers SSN
Product, Version, and Configuration (If applicable)
N/A
Suggested Mitigation/Remediation Actions
Blur/remove/cover the SSN on the image and replace the image on the slides.
Impact
PII leakage. Name and SSN.
steps: Locate the exposed file by searching for the filename on a search engine (e.g., DuckDuckGo).
Download the file and navigate to slide 13. Move the olive/green rectangle covering the SSN to reveal the sensitive information.
vuln_description: The vulnerability involves the exposure of a Social Security Number (SSN) on a slide within a downloadable file. The SSN is covered by a movable rectangle, which can be easily moved to reveal the underlying sensitive information. This issue was previously reported but not adequately fixed.
reason: The vulnerability is straightforward to discover as it involves locating a publicly accessible file and manipulating a visible element (the rectangle) to expose the SSN. There are no complex interactions or states involved, and the attack does not require novel logic.
